excerpt: Large, dramatic medieval fortress with panoramic views & historical relics on display.
detail_description: Rocca Maggiore is a grand medieval fortress that has loomed over Assisi for over 800 years. The castle offers panoramic views and houses historical artifacts. Nearby, visitors can explore the Roman Amphitheatre, now a public garden, and the Basilica di Santa Chiara, where St. Clare of Assisi is buried. Eremo dell Carceri, a serene monastery nestled in the trees just outside of town, provides another peaceful retreat.
name: Rocca Maggiore
address: Via della Rocca, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

excerpt: 13th-century church with a striking pink-&-white facade housing the tomb of St Clare.
detail_description: Basilica di Santa Chiara is a 13th-century church in Assisi, Italy, featuring a striking pink-and-white facade. It was built to honor St. Clare shortly after her burial in 1253 and was consecrated in 1265 by Pope Clement IV. The basilica houses the tomb of St. Clare and also preserves the Crucifix of San Damiano, which spoke to St. Francis.
name: Basilica di Santa Chiara
address: P.za Santa Chiara, 1, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

excerpt: 13th-century church with ornate friezes & statutes, plus the font where St Francis was baptized.
detail_description: The Cathedral of San Rufino is a 13th-century church located in Assisi, Italy. It is divided into two main churches, the Lower and Upper basilicas. The interior features ornate friezes, statues, and numerous chapels such as those dedicated to St. Mary Magdalene and St. Louis of Toulouse. The cathedral has an unmistakable Romanesque character with modern features added during the 16th century.
name: Cathedral of San Rufino
address: Piazza San Rufino, 3, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

excerpt: Landmark hillside Gothic church & site of Christian pilgrimage, decorated with noted medieval art.
detail_description: The Papal Basilica and Sacred Convent of Saint Francis in Assisi is an iconic Gothic church and a major Christian pilgrimage site. This UNESCO World Heritage Site consists of the Upper Basilica and the Lower Basilica, adorned with medieval art. The basilica also features smaller chapels like those dedicated to St Mary Magdalene and St Louis of Toulouse. It's recommended to use an audio guide to explore the rich history behind this impressive structure.
name: Papal Basilica and Sacred Convent of Saint Francis in Assisi
address: Piazza Inferiore di S. Francesco, 2, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

excerpt: 14th-century, Gothic-style church built from a former Greek temple & still retaining its façade.
detail_description: The Church of Santa Maria sopra Minerva in Assisi is a 14th-century Gothic-style church that was built from a former Greek temple, the Temple of Minerva. The church still retains the facade of the ancient temple, which dates back to the 1st century BC. Located in Piazza del Comune, this historic site also houses Roman remains near the altar and offers access to the ancient forum below through the nearby Civic Museum.
name: Church of Santa Maria sopra Minerva in Assisi
address: Piazza del Comune, 14, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

excerpt: Assisi is a hill town in central Italy’s Umbria region. It was the birthplace of St. Francis (1181–1226), one of Italy’s patron saints. The Basilica of St. Francis is a massive, 2-level church, consecrated in 1253. Its 13th-century frescoes portraying the life of St. Francis have been attributed to Giotto and Cimabue, among others. The crypt houses the saint’s stone sarcophagus.
detail_description: Assisi, a picturesque hill town in Umbria, Italy, is renowned as the birthplace of St. Francis, one of Italy's patron saints. The Basilica of St. Francis stands as a monumental church with 13th-century frescoes attributed to renowned artists like Giotto and Cimabue. The town hosts the Calendimaggio festival every May to celebrate spring's arrival with medieval processions and musical performances.
name: Assisi
address: 06081 Province of Perugia, Italy

excerpt: Modest, rustic-style 12th-century church & cloisters, said to be where Christ spoke to St Francis.
detail_description: San Damiano is a 12th-century church and cloisters located in Assisi, surrounded by terraced olive groves. It holds great significance as the place where St. Francis received a message from God to rebuild his house. This sanctuary embodies the virtues and values of St. Francis, representing an important part of his life.
name: San Damiano
address: Via San Damiano, 7, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Piazza del Comune in Assisi is a charming square surrounded by historic landmarks, offering visitors a perfect spot to unwind and immerse themselves in the town's ambiance. The square is encircled by notable buildings such as the Palazzo del Capitano del Popolo and the ancient Temple of Minerva, which traces its origins back to the 1st century BC.
name: Piazza del Comune
address: 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

excerpt: 17th-century church associated with St. Francis of Assisi, home to a Franciscan museum & library.
detail_description: Chiesa Nuova di San Francesco Convertito is a 17th-century church in Assisi, Italy, closely associated with St. Francis of Assisi. It is built on the site of his father's house and is believed to be where he was locked up by his father for choosing a life of poverty. The church also houses a Franciscan museum and library.
name: Chiesa Nuova di San Francesco Convertito
address: Piazza Chiesa Nuova, 7, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Via San Francesco, along with Il Corso, is one of the bustling main streets in the area. It is lined with various shops selling religious souvenirs and memorabilia. While some may find it difficult to find high-quality items here, there are still unique finds such as charming Francis-inspired leather sandal magnets that catch the eye of many visitors.
name: Via San Francesco
address: 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Piazza del Comune in Assisi is a historic square that dates back to Roman times and flourished as a bustling trade center during the Middle Ages. The square boasts an array of remarkable monuments, including the ancient Roman Temple of Minerva, which has been transformed into a church, the Fountain of the Lions, and the tabernacle. Visitors can soak up the vibrant atmosphere by sitting on the stone steps of the Temple of Minerva while indulging in some gelato and observing local life.
name: Piazza del Comune
address: 1, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Bosco di San Francesco, managed by the Italian National Trust (FAI), is a serene woodland area near the Basilica of St. Francis in Umbria. Covering about 64 hectares, it offers visitors a chance to explore ancient woodlands, olive groves, and walk along the Tescio River on a network of trails.
name: Bosco di San Francesco
address: Via Ponte dei Galli, 1, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: The Oratorio dei Pellegrini is a small triangular church that originally served as a hostel for pilgrims traveling to Rome to pay homage to the remains of Francis. The chapel features beautiful art and frescoes, including works by Matteo da Gualdo from the 15th century. It is tucked away behind a glass door on via San Francesco, offering a quiet space to admire its magnificent paintings and frescoes without disturbing praying pilgrims.
name: Oratorio dei pellegrini
address: Via San Francesco, 13, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: The Pinacoteca Comunale Palazzo Vallemani is a stunning example of 16th-century Baroque architecture and home to the Municipal Picture Gallery, which is definitely worth a visit. The gallery features treasures such as Matteo da Gualdo's 'Immaculate Conception of the Virgin' and detached frescoes rescued from various churches and buildings across Assisi, including significant works by Ottaviano Nelli.
name: Pinacoteca Comunale Palazzo Vallemani
address: Via San Francesco, 12, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Piazza del Comune, located in Assisi, is a bustling square surrounded by significant historical landmarks such as the Temple of Minerva and the impressive Torre del Popolo. As the main square of the town, it exudes a vibrant atmosphere and serves as a central hub for various activities.
name: Piazza del Comune
address: 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: The Basilica superiore di San Francesco d'Assisi is a grand 13th-century complex consisting of two churches. The Gothic Basilica Superiore houses the famous cycle of Giotto depicting the life of St. Francis, while the older Basilica Inferiore preserves works by Cimabue, Pietro Lorenzetti, and Simone Martini.
name: Basilica superiore di San Francesco d'Assisi
address: Porta S. Francesco, 1, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: St. Francis Gate is a significant entrance to the historical richness of the Historic Center of Assisi, known as the birthplace of St. Francis and revered for its religious, historical, and artistic importance. The gate leads visitors to periodical exhibits and fairs that enhance their experience in this beautiful destination.
name: St. Francis Gate
address: Via Fontebella, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: The Roman Forum and Archaeological Museum in Assisi, Italy, offers a surprising glimpse into the town's ancient past. Situated beneath the Piazza del Commune, these partially excavated Roman ruins date back to before the 1st century. Visitors can access them through passages from the Museo Civico or explore shops that have opened their basements to reveal glimpses of this historical treasure.
name: Roman Forum and Archaeological Museum
address: Via Portica, 2, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: When visiting Assisi, don't miss out on the Chiesa di Santa Maria Maggiore / Santuario della Spogliazione. This historic church dates back to the 11th century and is home to the relics of Carlo Acutis, a beloved figure known for his deep devotion to the Eucharist. The crypt of Santa Maria Maggiore also features ruins of a Roman house, with wall paintings from excavations displayed in a nearby museum off Piazza del Comune.
name: Chiesa di Santa Maria Maggiore / Santuario della Spogliazione
address: Piazza del Vescovado, 3, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: In the charming town of Assisi, Torre del Popolo stands tall over Piazza del Comune, alongside other famous landmarks like Palazzo del Capitano del Popolo and Tempio di Minerva. The area is also home to the Pinacoteca Comunale, which houses a vast collection of Renaissance frescoes and paintings. Visitors can explore the 13th-century tower and make reservations in advance to climb it for panoramic views of the town.
name: Torre del Popolo
address: Piazza del Comune, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

excerpt: Refined Italian dishes in a brick vault with glass floors, above remains of an ancient Roman villa.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Assisi, La Locanda del Cardinale offers a dining experience that beautifully marries history with modern culinary artistry. Set within an ancient Roman villa, this upscale restaurant features stunning brick vaults and glass floors that allow diners to gaze down at the remnants of a bygone era, including part of the street leading to the Temple of Minerva. The ambiance is both elegant and inviting, enhanced by contemporary decor and sparkling chandeliers that complement the historical setting.
name: La Locanda del Cardinale
address: Piazza del Vescovado, 8, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: La Bottega Dei Sapori is a charming eatery located on Piazza del Comune, 34. The cozy venue offers a delightful selection of porchetta, meats, cheeses, and panini at great prices. The owner takes pride in presenting authentic dishes sourced from the family farm. Guests can savor exquisite flatbread sandwiches featuring pecorino cheese and pancetta while enjoying fantastic local wines.
name: La Bottega Dei Sapori
address: Piazza del Comune, 34, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Ristorante il Vicoletto is a trendy and cozy place located in the historic center of Assisi, offering a modern twist on Umbrian dishes. Tucked away in a small street, it provides an oasis of tranquility where guests can enjoy refined dishes made with simple and genuine ingredients.
name: Ristorante il Vicoletto
address: Vicolo dei Macelli Vecchi, 1, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Located on Piazza del Comune, Libreria Tipografia Zubboli is a historic shop that has been in the family since 1870. It offers a unique selection of artisan stationery, including exquisite hand-made marbled paper notebooks and leather-bound cotton paper notebooks. In addition to history books and travel guides, the shop also provides personalized writing paper and other traditional items. Visitors can find beautiful cards with images of Saint Francis and the Child for special occasions like Christmas.
name: Libreria Tipografia Zubboli
address: Piazza del Comune, 18, Via S. Gregorio, 1/b, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Foro Romano is accessible from the -1 level of the Matteotti car park, offering a pedestrian path to the city center with a beautiful view of the historic area. However, it's important to note that due to stairways without slides, this route may not be suitable for strollers or prams.
name: Foro Romano
address: Piazza Giacomo Matteotti, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

excerpt: Wooded, hillside hermitage & oratory dating from the 13th century, where St Francis came to pray.
detail_description: Eremo delle Carceri is a 13th-century hermitage and oratory located in the wooded hills near Assisi, Italy. This site holds great significance as it was a place of prayer and retreat for St. Francis, the Patron Saint of Italy. The hermitage is situated about 4 km east of Assisi, surrounded by dense woods against Monte Subasio. It remains unchanged since St.
name: Eremo delle Carceri
address: Via Eremo delle Carceri, 38, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

excerpt: Vast, 16th-century domed church where St Francis founded his order, with a history & art museum.
detail_description: Basilica di Santa Maria degli Angeli is a vast 16th-century church located about 4km beneath Assisi. It houses the Porziuncola chapel, where St Francis started the Franciscan movement. The nearby Cappella del Transito marks the site of St Francis's death. The basilica also features Michelangelo's Cloister, which displays over 400 works of art including sculptures and reliefs.
name: Basilica di Santa Maria degli Angeli
address: Piazza Porziuncola, 1, 06081 Santa Maria degli Angeli PG, Italy

detail_description: The Assisi Diocesan Museum, established in 1941 by Bishop Giuseppe Placido Niccolini, offers a fascinating journey through nine sections showcasing over a hundred exhibits. Visitors can explore archaeological displays in the Corridor, admire detached frescoes in the Master of St. Clare room, and marvel at the polyptych of San Rufino in the Nicolo Alunno room. The museum also features the Crypt of San Rufino with its symbols of the four evangelists.
name: Assisi Diocesan Museum
address: Piazza San Rufino, 3, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: The Portico of Monte Frumentario in Assisi is a must-visit spot, offering a glimpse into the enchanting world of Santa Claus and his elves. The area boasts stunning ancient architecture and picturesque landscapes that showcase the beauty of Umbria. Visitors can take leisurely strolls, savor coffee with breathtaking views, and immerse themselves in the fascinating history of this charming village. While exploring the Basilica nearby is highly recommended, travelers should be cautious of local restaurants with questionable practices.
name: Portico of Monte Frumentario
address: Via San Francesco, 5A, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Assisi, the Museo della Porziuncola is a captivating destination that evokes profound emotions and spiritual reflections. Visitors often find themselves enveloped in an atmosphere rich with history, as the presence of Saint Francis resonates throughout the space. The museum offers a thoughtfully designed route that allows guests to explore its treasures at a leisurely pace while avoiding crowds.
name: Museo della Porziuncola
address: Piazza Porziuncola, 1, 06081 Santa Maria degli Angeli PG, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque hills near Assisi, Cantina Tili Vini Bio offers an unforgettable experience for wine and food enthusiasts alike. Imagine embarking on a thrilling truffle hunt alongside a troubadour and his loyal dog, culminating in a delightful four-course lunch featuring this exquisite ingredient. Visitors rave about their time at the winery, participating in engaging activities like Umbria Cooking Classes and immersive winemaker experiences that showcase the family-run vineyard's rich history dating back to the 12th century.
name: Cantina Tili Vini Bio
address: Via della Cannella, 2, 06081 Capodacqua PG, Italy

detail_description: At Cantina SAIO in Assisi, visitors can indulge in a delightful wine tasting experience paired with a charming picnic. The friendly staff, particularly Agnese, are fluent in English and provide insightful information about the local wines and olive oils. Guests can enjoy reasonably priced tastings while soaking up stunning views of Assisi at sunset.
name: Cantina SAIO Assisi Degustazione vino, olio e prodotti tipici
address: Via Campiglione, 94/A, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Porta San Francesco is an ancient entrance to Perugia, modified in the 15th century and adorned with frescoes discovered in 1911. It's part of the remaining gates of the medieval city walls, representing the entrance to Assisi's historic center. Visitors describe it as a beautiful door with a medieval touch and a wonderful place exuding peace and serenity.
name: Porta San Francesco
address: Viale Guglielmo Marconi, 2, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Chiesa di Santa Maria delle Rose is a deconsecrated church located near San Ruffino in Assisi. It is a must-visit for its rare beauty and spiritual intensity, featuring two impactful works by Guido Dettoni that evoke a sense of prayer and meditation. The church also houses a series of sculptures, creating a modern museum-like atmosphere where visitors can admire art and interact with the artwork.
name: Chiesa di Santa Maria delle Rose
address: Via Santa Maria delle Rose, 10, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

name: Assisi Galleria d'Arte 6C
address: Via S. Rufino, 6C, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

excerpt: Mountainous regional park overlooking Assisi, covered with forest, meadows & olive groves.
detail_description: Mount Subasio, located in the Umbria region, is a picturesque regional park that offers a serene retreat for visitors. The mountain is covered with lush forests, meadows, and olive groves, providing ample opportunities for outdoor activities such as hiking, biking, and horseback riding. As you explore the trails, keep an eye out for wildlife including squirrels, wild boar, weasels, and wild cats.
name: Mount Subasio
address: Loc. Cà Piombino, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: The "Volta Pinta" in Piazza del Comune is regarded as Assisi's most significant and enigmatic work. Situated within the Palazzo dei Priori, this exquisitely frescoed barrel vault was created in 1556 under the directive of the Sienese governor Marcello Tuto. Adorned with grotesque and comical figures, little is known about the artist behind this remarkable piece of art.
name: La Volta Pinta
address: Piazza del Comune, 10, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: The Lyric Theater Assisi is an exceptional venue that leaves a lasting impression. It has hosted various events, including the Albora meeting, which was highly anticipated by attendees. The theater's shows are nothing short of extraordinary, captivating audiences with their brilliance. In particular, Opera Queen delivered a marvelous performance that left everyone in awe. The theater continues to maintain its high standards and remains at the forefront of excellence in the performing arts.
name: Lyrick Theatre Assisi
address: Viale Gabriele D'Annunzio, 06081 Santa Maria degli Angeli PG, Italy

detail_description: Fontana dei Tre Leoni is a beautiful fountain located in the square of the Municipality of Assisi. It represents the three urban districts with three lions and adds a special charm to the city. The fountain is a point of interest in this spacious area, along with other attractions like Torre del Popolo and Palazzo dei Priori. Visitors can also explore the Roman Forum beneath the square.
name: Fontana dei Tre Leoni
address: Piazza del Comune, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Embark on a serene journey through the Terzo Paradiso Bosco San Francesco, an enchanting trail that begins at the Santa Croce visitor center. This picturesque path meanders alongside the Tescio River, which is currently dry, creating a unique atmosphere. As you stroll beneath the olive trees, you'll feel as if you've stepped into paradise; it's a truly uplifting experience that allows you to escape from daily stresses.
name: Terzo Paradiso Bosco San Francesco - Michelangelo Pistoletto
address: Vicolo Santa Margherita, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: B.A.T. Assisi is a splendid art gallery showcasing an impressive array of artistic masterpieces. The collection encompasses diverse types of artwork, ranging from stunning jewelry pieces to exquisite works of art in various forms. The owner exudes both kindness and professionalism, while the staff demonstrates great competence in assisting visitors. With Christmas around the corner, it presents an opportune time to explore this exceptional gallery and select a unique piece to cherish.
name: B.A.T. Assisi
address: Via S. Rufino, 6c, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Santuario di San Francesco Piccolino is a small chapel believed to be the birthplace of Saint Francis, located near the Chiesa Nuova and Oratorio di San Francesco Piccolino. The chapel holds historical significance and is associated with the legend of Saint Francis' birth. Visitors can experience a sense of spirituality, tranquility, and peace in this magical place.
name: Oratorio di San Francesco Piccolino
address: piazzetta S. Francesco piccolino, Italy

detail_description: Museo della Memoria, Assisi 1943-1944 - Visite su prenotazione is a lesser-known museum in Assisi that pays tribute to the courageous locals who sheltered 300 Jews from the Nazis during World War II. The museum showcases the remarkable efforts of individuals such as priests, monks, nuns, and printer Luigi Brizi and his son who forged hundreds of ID documents on an old printing press.
name: Museo della Memoria, Assisi 1943-1944 - Visite su prenotazione
address: Piazza del Vescovado, 3, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

name: Comunità monastica di Bose, San Masseo
address: Via Petrosa, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

name: Arco del Seminario
address: Via San Francesco, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the charming Piazza San Rufino, the Fontana di San Rufino is a delightful sight that captures the essence of this historic area. This Romanesque fountain features a rectangular travertine basin adorned with eight sections and six lava throats, providing refreshing water that is especially welcome on warm summer days. While it may not be the original centerpiece of the cathedral square from 1035, its rich history includes being relocated from Piazza San Francesco during the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries.
name: Fontana di San Rufino
address: Piazza San Rufino, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

excerpt: The National Gallery is in this medieval building with frescoes & a bell tower for sweeping views.
detail_description: The Palazzo dei Priori, located in Perugia, Italy, has a rich history dating back to ancient times. Originally known as "Perusia," the city witnessed significant events such as the civil war between Octavian Augustus and Marcus Anthony. After being rebuilt by Emperor Augustus, it flourished during the Middle Ages and became part of the State of the Church in 1531. The establishment of the Government of Consuls and the University further contributed to its historical significance.
name: Palazzo dei Priori
address: Piazza IV Novembre, 06123 Perugia PG, Italy

name: TILI 21 Cantina Bio | Organic Winery | Degustazioni & Winetasting | Assisi DOC, Olio EVO ed altri prodotti tipici
address: Via della Cannella, 21, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

name: Palazzo Bonacquisti
address: Piazza del Comune, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy

detail_description: Porta San Giacomo is a historic city gate in Assisi, dating back to the Middle Ages and once part of the medieval fortifications. Positioned strategically, it connects Assisi with Rocca Maggiore and serves as an access point to the old town. Over time, unique frescoes were added to the gate, which are now housed in the Municipal Art Gallery.
name: Porta San Giacomo
address: Via Cardinale Raffaele Merry del Val, 13, 06081 Assisi PG, Italy
